author: Jeff S.S

text:
This game is full of hilarious pirate action and exciting environments to discover! And then you get this calm, heavenly piece of music, that basically says to you: "Hold on, you've already made it this far, and you'll reach your goal soon! Keep searching around in these wonderful, shimmering ice caves, because in the end, you'll meet with a good old seal friend! He will be there for you to help you progress through his beautiful home!"

It is so heart-warming!

author: assasin bear

text: I just realized DKC2 has 2 kinds of water stages.  The first type being the rather grim and tense ship hold type levels while the more soothing atmosphere type levels take place in these crystal caverns made of ice.  What's quite ironic is the calmer ice cave themed water levels come later in the game in the sixth world and as such are not surprisingly harder then the more intense atmosphere ones in the ship holds.  Well there is Black Ice Battle in the secret world 8 which doesn't have water in it.  Unless of course you consider it a water stage by technicality due to it being all frozen.

text: Probably the most nostalic video game tune for me...DKC 2 is my favourite game together with OoT and this theme just reminds me so much to the days back in 95/96, when my older brother and I played this game for weeks...great times!
author: Ray

text:
Indeed. I think I haven't played anything except DKC 2, as it was the only DK game we had back then. Getting introduced to so much gameplay as kid, it was pure joy.

Simply because of that, I started playing older games now, that I haven't played yet. Starting with Fallout 1. Wish me lots of luck and fun, wishing it to you, too!

text:
It might be snowing when I wake up tomorrow morning.  I have this song on my iPhone and have it as my alarm.  If it IS snowing and I wake up to this song it'll be the best day ever. 

I live in Southeast Texas by the by, so snow around here is a PRETTY BIG DEAL.

text: What a good way to treat yourself. Did it snow?
author: Marcus Mührmann-Lund

text:
@Marcus Mührmann-Lund
Of course it didn't.  :(  It DID get cold enough to freeze the rain to my windshield to where I needed to get water to thaw it out...and THAT water froze into icicles by the end of the work day.  XD

text:
Rare isn't the same anymore, unfortunately. Even if they ever come back to Nintendo, most of Rare personnel left, including the Stamper brothers, the ones responsible for founding the company.

Rare's acquisition by Microsoft was, definitely, the end of an era in video gaming history.
